function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Estimating COVID-19 fatality rate and prevalence of obesity using built and natural environment variables could lead to unobserved heterogeneity and potential biases.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of fatality rate and obesity prevalence may lead to ineffective public health interventions and resource allocation.","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analysis, consider additional control variables, and validate results against real-world data.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling software, data visualization tools, and machine learning algorithms for sensitivity analysis.","People":"Public health policymakers, data scientists, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Treating parameters as random variables may lead to unreliable estimates and inconsistent model predictions.","Impact":"Unreliable estimates may result in inappropriate policy interventions and misallocation of resources.","Mitigation":"Use robust statistical methods, cross-validation, and check for consistency in model predictions across different samples.","Technologies":"Robust regression algorithms, cross-validation techniques, and consistency checks in statistical software.","People":"Data scientists, statisticians, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies."}]}
